## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
library(metafor)
#ongoing project to evaluate accuracy of spot sign

dat <- data.frame(author=c("wada","goldstein","park","li","demchuk","ederies","evans","brouwers","romero"),
year=c(2007,2007,2010,2011,2012,2009,2010,2012,2013),
xi=c(10,13,10,23,37,16,7,33,18), 
ni=c(13,58,19,30,60,39,48,71,41))
dat$pi <- with(dat, xi/ni)
dat <- escalc(measure="PFT", xi=xi, ni=ni, data=dat, add=0)	
res <- rma(yi, vi, method="REML", data=dat, slab=paste(author))
result<-predict(res, transf=transf.ipft.hm, targs=list(ni=dat$ni))
result$pred
forest(res, transf=transf.ipft.hm, targs=list(ni=dat$ni), xlim=c(-1,1.5),refline=result$pred,cex=.5, ilab=cbind(dat$year,dat$xi, dat$ni),
       ilab.xpos=c(-.55,-.25,-.05),digits=3)
op <- par(cex=.5, font=2)
text(-1.0,      11, "author ",     pos=4)
text(c(-.55,-.275,-.025), 	11, c("year", "growth", "subjects"))
text(1.5,                  11, "PPV [95% CI]", pos=2)
par(op)

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
#funnel plot
plot(res)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
